intro: Miconia nigricalyx, commonly known as black-leaved miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with high humidity and warm climates. The plant is characterized by its large, dark green leaves that often have a glossy surface and prominent veins. It produces showy, clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the summer months. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to spread in natural habitats.
